intro: Touchiroa tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly touchiroa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and insects. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in coastal and forested areas of New Zealand.
